contentrichtext.text: {{Use dmy dates|date=November 2012}} {{Other people|John Russell}} {{ref improve|date=September 2012}} {{Infobox person | honorific_prefix = The Reverend | name = John Russell | honorific_suffix = | image = Parson-John-Russel.jpg | image_size = 200px | alt = | caption = Parson John ("Jack") Russell. | birth_name = | birth_date = {{Birth date|df=yes|1795|12|21}} | birth_place = [[Dartmouth, Devon]] | death_date = {{Death date and age|df=yes|1883|04|28|1795|12|21}} | death_place = | death_cause = | body_discovered = | resting_place = | resting_place_coordinates = <!-- {{Coord|LAT|LONG|display=inline}} --> | monuments = | residence = | nationality = British | alma_mater = [[Exeter College, Oxford]] | known_for = [[Dog breeder]] | influenced = [[Jack Russell Terrier]], [[Parson Russell Terrier]], [[Russell Terrier]] | home_town = Swimbridge, Devon }} '''John "Jack" Russell''' (21 December 1795 â€“ 28 April 1883), known as "The Sporting Parson", was an enthusiastic hunter and [[dog breeder]] as well as an ordained [[cleric]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.parsonrussellterrierclub.co.uk/history.html |title=The Parson Russell Terrier Club, UK - Introduction to the breed |publisher=Parsonrussellterrierclub.co.uk |date= |accessdate=13 April 2011}}</ref> Russell was born in [[Dartmouth, England]], the eldest son of John Russell and Nora (Jewell).<ref name="biog464">{{cite book|last=Stephen|first=Leslie|title=Dictionary of National Biography|publisher=New York Macmillan|year=1885|page=464}}</ref> He was educated at [[Plympton Grammar School]], [[Blundell's School]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.blundells.org/admin/school_notable-obs.htm#18thc |title=Famous OBs |publisher=www.blundells.org |date= |accessdate=13 April 2011}}</ref> and [[Exeter College, Oxford]]. It was at Exeter College, legend has it, that he spotted a little white [[terrier]] dog with dark tan spots over her eyes, ears and at the tip of her tail, who was owned by a milkman.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.jack-russell-terrier.co.uk/breed/history_of_the_breed.html |title=A brief history of the Jack Russell - Jack Russell Terrier UK |publisher=Jack-russell-terrier.co.uk |date= |accessdate=13 April 2011}}</ref> Russell bought the dog on the spot and this animal, called "Trump", became the foundation dog of a line of [[fox hunting]] terriers that would eventually come to be known as [[Jack Russell Terrier]]s. Russell came to live in a village called [[Swimbridge]] in North Devon. After his death, the local [[public house]] was renamed the Jack Russell Inn; it still stands today. Russell was a founding member of [[The Kennel Club]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://dogwebs.net/PlentifulRun/aboutus.asp |title=Plentiful Run Parson Russell Terriers - About Us |publisher=Dogwebs.net |date= |accessdate=13 April 2011}}</ref> He helped to write the [[breed standard]] for the [[Fox Terrier (Smooth)]] and became a respected judge. He did not show his own [[Fox Terrier|fox terrier]]s on the [[Conformation show|conformation]] bench, saying that the difference between his dogs and the conformation dogs could be likened to the difference between wild and cultivated flowers. ==See also== *[[Jack Russell Terrier]] *[[Parson Russell Terrier]] *[[Russell Terrier]] ==References== {{Reflist}} ==Further reading== *''Parson Jack Russell: The Hunting Legend 1795-1883'' by Charles Noon, Halsgrove Publishers. *{{cite encyclopedia |encyclopedia=[[Oxford Dictionary of National Biography]]| accessdate=17 April 2008| year=2004|publisher=[[Oxford University Press]]}} {{Authority control|VIAF=18659921}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Russell, Jack | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = British dog breeder | DATE OF BIRTH = 21 December 1795 | PLACE OF BIRTH = [[Dartmouth, Devon]] | DATE OF DEATH = 28 April 1883 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Russell, Jack}} [[Category:Dog breeders]] [[Category:People from Dartmouth, Devon]] [[Category:1795 births]] [[Category:1883 deaths]] [[Category:People educated at Blundell's School]] [[Category:Alumni of Exeter College, Oxford]] {{UK-bio-stub}} {{dog-stub}}
